byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Obama administration officials brief reports in advance of Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu's speech to joint session of Congress and argue that Netanyahu has failed to offer reasonable alternative to proposals for curbing Iran's nuclear program; talks with Iran appear to be on verge of some kind of agreement.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu failed to present a feasible alternative to American proposals for curbing Iran’s nuclear program.

headline.main: White House Offers Rebuttal Before Netanyahu’s Speech
headline.print_headline: White House Offers Rebuttal Before Netanyahu’s Speech

snippet: The Obama administration said Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu failed to present a feasible alternative to American proposals for curbing Iran’s nuclear program.
